author: Eva Dou
title: China Stifles Critics of Plan to Extend Xi Jinping’s Reign
text:
BEIJING—China has launched a broad effort to silence critics of a proposal that would allow President Xi Jinping to extend his reign indefinitely, as Beijing seeks to break decades of political precedent with minimal domestic uproar.

Beijing has mobilized multiple arms of the government to suppress criticism of the Communist Party proposal to remove presidential term limits—expected to be approved at an annual parliamentary session that kicks off Monday—with lawyers threatened with disbarment, police visits to critics and... RELATED VIDEO What’s Expected for China in the Next Five Years? China’s Communist Party concluded its weeklong congress, giving President Xi Jinping authority not seen in decades. It sets the stage for him to stay in power after his second five-year term expires. Here's what to expect. Photo: AP (Originally published Oct. 27, 2017)
